column4: my system volume is very low .. i cant change it trough the basic things ... i think its a problem of my driver or interface .. can you help ?? Or do you have a good tutorial ??
my system volume is very low .. i cant change it trough the basic things ... i think its a problem of my driver or interface .. can you help ?? Or do you have a good tutorial ??
my system volume is very low .. i cant change it trough the basic things ... i think its a problem of my driver or interface .. can you help ?? Or do you have a good tutorial ??
Are you running gnome and have you installed any kde apps that use the kde sound system?
I use Kalarm and this happens to me.  Sometimes the sound control/mixer for KDE loads and mutes the gnome mixer.  Sometimes not. Do you have two "speaker" icons by the clock?
no i dont have 2 speaker icons near the clock ... and the tutorial a other guy gave to me uses commands, which i dont have installed !?
by other commands.. do you mean alsamixer?
If you check your "System Monitor" (appelate I've got loaded on top bar) do you have any services loaded like kded or kdeinit or klauncher?
no .. i just have skype, gaim and now amarokh
cant i use amarok ??.. or do i have to uninstall it temporarly

You can uninstall without removing everything just as a test to see how the volume reacts...I'm not sure if this will actually do anything but if a KDE app is causing the issue this might let you know.
i hate things like that .... im now going to remove all KDE software from Synaptic ...
another question.... was this card working before?
i worked very well with ubuntu 6.06
or just sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop and try kde in a session to see what happens.
oh .. nearly 500MB  .. this could take a while ...
